intro: Macromeria notata, commonly known as the yellow sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in desert or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, with a rough texture, and it produces small, clustered inflorescences. Macromeria notata is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a hardy species in arid regions.
